com.imaginea.android.sugarcrm.services

Class SugarService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • com.imaginea.android.sugarcrm.services.SugarService

  • public class SugarService
extends Service
    SugarService, follows the APIDemos pattern of command handling example of a Service.

      void onStart(Intent intent, int startId)

      int onStartCommand(Intent intent, int flags, int startId)
      static void registerMessenger(Messenger messenger)
      We only register one Messenger as only one Activity is connected to us at given time.modify to add to a list if we need multiple activity support -?? this will never happen in current android architecture; will happen if single screen holds two activities ???
      static void sendMessage(int what, java.lang.Object obj)
      messages will be sent to the activity or any component that is currently registered with this service made static so can directly call this to display the status of the.
      static void unregisterMessenger(Messenger messenger)
      keeping the messenger in case we go ahead with multiple listeners Activities should unregister in onPause and register in onResume so that they continue to receive messages specific to them, further filtering can be done while sending messages so that unwanted messages are not sent.

        public void onStart(Intent intent,
           int startId)
        This is the old onStart method that will be called on the pre-2.0 // platform. On 2.0 or later we override onStartCommand() so this // method will not be called.

        intent - the intent
        startId - the start id

      • registerMessenger

        public static void registerMessenger(Messenger messenger)
        We only register one Messenger as only one Activity is connected to us at given time.modify to add to a list if we need multiple activity support -?? this will never happen in current android architecture; will happen if single screen holds two activities ???
        Parameters:
        messenger - a android.os.Messenger object.

      • unregisterMessenger

        public static void unregisterMessenger(Messenger messenger)
        keeping the messenger in case we go ahead with multiple listeners Activities should unregister in onPause and register in onResume so that they continue to receive messages specific to them, further filtering can be done while sending messages so that unwanted messages are not sent.
        Parameters:
        messenger - a android.os.Messenger object.

        public static void sendMessage(int what,

        messages will be sent to the activity or any component that is currently registered with this service made static so can directly call this to display the status of the.
        Parameters:
        what - a int.
        obj - a Object object.
